title: Is Jayson Tatum practicing with Celtics teammates? Latest social media post seems to indicate as much
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Jayson Tatum practiced with teammates during Celtics' workout in San Francisco, fueling speculation of his imminent return.
Celtics shared Instagram photos showing Tatum involved in team exercises, but no official return date announced.
Tatum participated in 5-on-5 scrimmages and practiced with Maine Celtics, indicating progress in his recovery.

title: NBC Sports broadcast teams rise to the occasion with Olympic calls from Milan Cortina
author: Chad Finn
bullets: NBC broadcasters Kenny Albert and A.J. Mleczko effectively conveyed Team USA's gold medal win in women's hockey at Milan Cortina.
Terry Gannon, Tara Lipinski, and Johnny Weir allowed Alysa Liu's gold-medal figure skating performance to unfold largely without commentary.
NBC emphasized strategic silence during key Olympic moments, enhancing the viewer experience of Team USA's victories.

title: Free MBTA bus program extended â€” for now
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: Boston extends free rides on MBTA bus routes 23, 28, and 29 through June using leftover federal funds.
Routes in Mattapan, Dorchester, and Roxbury have been fare-free since March 2022 as part of a pilot program.
Mayor Wu is in talks with the MBTA about long-term funding, but plans post-June remain uncertain.

title: Snow totals: See how much snow your town got
author: Boston.com Staff
bullets: Franklin County saw the highest snow accumulation, with Leyden reporting 6.5 inches as of Saturday morning.
Essex County recorded significant snowfall with Haverhill receiving up to 5 inches and other towns averaging around 4 inches.
A major storm with blizzard conditions and possible power outages is forecast for Sunday night into Monday in Massachusetts.

title: She’s running the 2026 Boston Marathon for the 2013 bombing victims
author: Annie Jonas
bullets: Marissa LaRosa, 30, from Canton, will run the 2026 Boston Marathon to honor the victims of the 2013 bombing.
LaRosa has been inspired by her colleague Annie, a veteran marathon runner, who helped her prepare for the race.
April 20, 2026, holds special significance for LaRosa as she fulfills her dream and commemorates the victims.

title: NH man sentenced for using $1M in COVID relief funds to buy golf course
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: Michael Kirouac sentenced to 15 months for using $1M in COVID relief funds to buy a golf course.
The 38-year-old from Pembroke used roughly $600,000 of the funds for the Angus Lea Golf Course purchase.
Kirouac obtained EIDL loans under false pretenses, misusing funds intended for business payroll and expenses.

title: Man with 25-year record charged in high-end Boston shoplifting spree
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: Peter Cutelis, 40, charged with multiple larcenies over $1,200 and drug possession after shoplifting incidents in Boston.
Thefts occurred in November at Lululemon and Ralph Lauren stores; items valued at thousands of dollars, says DA.
Cutelis held without bail on fugitive charge; due for a court hearing on March 6 for probable cause.

title: Red Sox will keep Roman Anthony in leadoff spot for 2026 season. What could rest of lineup look like?
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Roman Anthony will be the leadoff hitter for the Boston Red Sox in the 2026 season.
Anthony hit .336 as a leadoff hitter last season, with six home runs and a 1.003 OPS.
Manager Alex Cora confirmed new first baseman Willson Contreras will hit cleanup for the Red Sox.

title: Margo Price talks AI, bro-country and meeting Joan Baez at the circus
author: Lauren Daley
bullets: Margo Price discusses her influences, including Joan Baez, and her connection to Massachusetts ahead of her Boston show.
Price's husband, Jeremy Ivey, has ties to Massachusetts, having lived in Athol and being briefly homeless in Boston.
Price's latest album 'Hard Headed Woman' was nominated for two Grammys, reflecting her defiant stance in country music.

title: She’s running Boston so children like her daughter get access to healthcare
author: Annie Jonas
bullets: Jordan Whitaker is running the 2026 Boston Marathon to support Mass. Eye and Ear's healthcare services.
Whitaker's daughter received critical treatment for infected cysts at Mass. Eye and Ear when other hospitals declined.
The Boston Marathon effort aims to help more children access necessary medical care like Whitaker's daughter received.
